sentences: Roselle Paulino Nava-Tan (born March 28, 1976), professionally and more commonly known as Roselle Nava, is a Filipino singer, film and television actress, and politician.
section: N/A

sentences: She is a multi-platinum female singer in the Philippines and one of the most in-demand divas during the 90s era.
section: N/A

sentences: She is tagged as the "Philippines' Sentimental Diva" and the "former supreme songbird of ABS-CBN".
section: N/A

sentences: She was formerly dubbed as the "90s Philippine Pop Queen".
section: N/A

sentences: She started her career as a part of ABS-CBN's defunct youth-oriented show Ang TV (1992–1997) together with Jolina Magdangal, Claudine Barretto, Antoinette Taus, etc.
section: N/A

sentences: She was also a regular host and performer of ASAP, the Philippines longest variety show, from 1995 to 2004 and since 2015.
section: N/A

sentences: She is the singer behind the hits like Bakit Nga Ba Mahal Kita, Maniniwala Ba Ako, Dahil Mahal Na Mahal Kita, Laging Ikaw Parin, Ikaw Pala, Mahal Mo Ba'y Di Na Ako, and Huwag Ka Nang Babalik.
section: N/A

sentences: From 1994 to 1995, she was hailed as the Best Female Singer of the Year for the song You by Awit Awards.

sentences: In 1994, her very first signature hit, Bakit Nga Ba Mahal Kita
section: == Showbiz career ==

sentences: (Why Do I Love You?), became the number one charted song in the Philippines and stayed in the radio charts for 8 months from 1994 to 1995.

sentences: It became the theme song of many Filipinos who went through heart breaks and got lost in love.

sentences: In 1997, however her commercialized success of Dahil Mahal Na Mahal Kita, her carrier single from her 3rd album (Roselle: On Higher Ground), emerged immediate success and even spanned a film with the same name and even in album registry.

sentences: in 2010, in 2013 by Vice Ganda for the soundtrack of the Primetime series Huwag Ka Lang Mawawala, and in 2018, Jonalyn Viray (aka Jona), for the teleserye Asintado.
section: == Showbiz career ==

sentences: In 2000, she revived the Barry Manilow song "Somewhere Down The Road" for the Blockbuster Film "Minsan Minahal Kita" which also was included in the Original Motion Picture Soundtrack; and in 2002, her comeback platinum hit with Star Records "Huwag Ka Nang Magbabalik for the film Ngayong Nandito Ka and Jologs.
section: == Showbiz career ==

sentences: In 2002, Roselle was chosen as the interpreter for the song, Free, composed by Gino Torres.

sentences: The demo version was recorded by Carol Banawa.
section: == Showbiz career ==

sentences: But the composer chose Roselle to do the final and live version.
section: == Showbiz career ==

sentences: It became as one of the finalists of ABS-CBN's JAM: Himig Handog sa Makabagong Kabataan.

sentences: It also became the theme song of ABS-CBN's summer station ID in the same year.
section: == Showbiz career ==

sentences: Roselle Nava's last album with Star Records (ABS-CBN's recording outfit) All About Love achieved the Platinum Status but was never awarded to her.
section: == Showbiz career ==

sentences: She moved to Viva Entertainment Agency and signed up for several projects.

sentences: VIVA did not commercialise her artistry as her recent albums got no awards.

sentences: The poor sales performance of her albums affected her singing career.
